intro: Koanophyllon panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian leafy grass, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Koanophyllon panamensis is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil.
